kaninator.graphics
Class AnimationFactory

java.lang.Object
  kaninator.graphics.AnimationFactory

public final class AnimationFactory
extends java.lang.Object

The only way to create Animations. Uses a HashMap to keep track of the Animations that have already been loaded in order to avoid duplicates. Also handles error checking internally, effectively returning a dummy Animation if the loading fails.

Author:
phedman
See Also:
Animation

Method Detail

createAnimation

private static Animation createAnimation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage buffer,
                                         boolean mirror,
                                         int height,
                                         int width,
                                         int column,
                                         double speed)
Internal method which creates an Animation from a BufferedImage containing the animation sheet. And then adds it to the ArrayList containing the different animation states.

Parameters:
buffer - The BufferedImage containing the animation sheet.
mirror - Whether the animation should be mirrored or not, effectively adding the mirrored animation to the ArrayList as well.
height - The height of a single animation frame.
width - The width of a single animation frame.
column - The column of the animation sheet we want to create an Animation from.
speed - The speed which the created Animation will run at.
Returns:
A single Animation.
See Also:
Animation

createAnimations

private static java.util.ArrayList<Animation> createAnimations(java.lang.String filepath,
                                                               boolean mirror,
                                                               int height,
                                                               int width,
                                                               double speed)
Internal method that creates an ArrayList of Animations from the sprite sheet contained at the file path. Handles errors internally and returns a dummy ArrayList of animations with the size 0 if the sprite sheet cannot be found or read.

Parameters:
filepath - The path to the image file containing the sprite sheet.
mirror - Whether the the animations after the first two should be mirrored as well. (The first two are the top/down directions and consequently cannot be mirrored)
height - The height of a single animation frame.
width - The width of a single animation frame.
speed - The speed which the created Animations will run at.
Returns:
An ArrayList of Animations. If unsuccessful it returns a dummy ArrayList of Animations of the size 0.
See Also:
Animation

updateTransparencies

protected static void updateTransparencies()
Updates the transparency values for all the Animations that the AnimationFactory knows about.

createAnimations

public static java.util.ArrayList<Animation> createAnimations(Drawable drawable)
Wraps a Drawable in the necessary layers to create a single-frame Animation from it. Used to simplify the passing of a single Drawable to a DynamicObject.

Parameters:
drawable - The Drawable object to be wrapped in an Animation.
Returns:
A single frame Animation containing the Drawable.
See Also:
Drawable, DynamicObject, Animation

getAnimations

public static java.util.ArrayList<Animation> getAnimations(java.lang.String filepath,
                                                           boolean mirror,
                                                           int height,
                                                           int width,
                                                           double speed)
Returns an ArrayList of Animations created from the sprite sheet contained at the file path. If the ArrayList of Animations previously has been loaded it automatically returns it from the internal HashMap. If the ArrayList of Animations cannot be found in the HashMap or at the file path, then it returns a dummy ArrayList of Animations of the size 0.

Parameters:
filepath - The path to the image file containing the sprite sheet.
mirror - Whether the the animations after the first two should be mirrored as well. (The first two are the top/down directions and consequently cannot be mirrored)
height - The height of a single animation frame.
width - The width of a single animation frame.
speed - The speed which the created Animations will run at.
Returns:
An ArrayList of Animations. If unsuccessful it returns a dummy ArrayList of Animations of the size 0.
See Also:
Animation

cloneAnimations

public static java.util.ArrayList<Animation> cloneAnimations(java.util.ArrayList<Animation> anims)
Clones an ArrayList of Animations, the cloned ArrayList of Animation uses the same Images as the original one, but has individual states.

Parameters:
anims - The ArrayList of Animations you want to clone.
Returns:
A cloned ArrayList of Animations.
See Also:
Animation
